page.title: 14Transport in the area
page.content: There are no rivers or railway running through our area. We have no airports. Tetsworth has a bus service because it is on the A40 route between London and Oxford. Once a week (Tuesdays) there is a morning and an afternoon bus to Thame for the weekly market. Older children travel to school on a school bus. There are very few homes without their own transport and many families have more than one vehicle. There are a few people who travel about on horseback or with a horse and carriage. During the winter months the roads, especially to Thame, are liable to be closed by drifting snow. The constant hum of the many cars and lorries using the M40 which runs to the south of the area often reminds us of the volume of traffic the motorway carries past the area.
